p: Water grab samples were collected bimonthly from established transect sites ( n = 14 sampling points, July 2011â€“July 2017; Fig 1) located at 1-km intervals along the Chobe River above the 2 water intake stations for the community. Land use along this reach of the river consisted of protected area and urban land use. Water quality assessments were conducted to estimate in-river concentrations of E. coli and total suspended solids (TSS), as previously described [ 26].
